neighbors.name: Thomas Elliott
neighbors.claims: Thomas Elliott is the listed owner of two land parcels (Tax Map IDs 16.-1-24 and 16.-1-1.2) in Genesee County’s property records, indicating agricultural land ownership in the area [Genesee County PROS](https://www.geneseeny.gov/Services/Property). No references to Thomas Elliott in local news or civic minutes were found, suggesting he has not publicly voiced opinions on development proposals [The Batavian](https://www.thebatavian.com/search?query=%22Thomas+Elliott%22).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local agriculture figure reach out personally, emphasizing that project plans will respect existing farm operations and soil/drainage needs to address Elliott’s likely concerns.

neighbors.name: Gardiner Cemetery
neighbors.claims: Organizational landowner – see ORG table for detailed profile. The Gardiner Cemetery parcel is owned by a local cemetery association (nonprofit); no individual resident is attached to this entry. **See ORG table.**

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the cemetery’s managing board or caretaker through the town to ensure any development plans do not disturb cemetery grounds or access.

neighbors.name: Glenda Bloom
neighbors.claims: Glenda Bloom appears as the owner of a rural Genesee County parcel (Tax ID 16.-1-1.12), suggesting she owns open land or a rural residence in the project vicinity [Genesee County PROS](https://www.geneseeny.gov/Services/Property). No public statements or media references by Bloom regarding development or energy projects were found in local records, indicating she has not taken a visible stance on such issues [The Batavian](https://www.thebatavian.com/search?query=%22Glenda+Bloom%22).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a neighborly introduction (through a mutual acquaintance or town event), stressing measures to minimize noise, preserve the rural character, and address any property value concerns.

overview_summary: All neighboring landowners identified have an **unknown** position on the development, with no public statements or records indicating support or opposition. None hold prominent public offices or high-profile roles – most are private landholders (including one small cemetery organization) – suggesting a generally **low** level of direct community influence.
